Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: in handle zone, black-figure decoration consisting of lower part of female or male figure (only foot and part of garment remaining) to left; at right, possibly legs of stool; to right trace of handle root roughly glazed; below,dilute line above black zone with dilute line at bottom; reserved lower body.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 399, no. B588)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0480) (Phase 1)
